channel.title: Tech on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Tech on Home

item.title: GRWM: for production
item.description: GRWM: Get Your Kubernetes Workload Ready for Production By asking ourselves the right questions about a deployment’s needs we can effectively use the orchestration features provided by Kubernetes to ensure our workload is production ready and resilient. The focus will be on vanilla Kubernetes objects and best practices, but I’ll touch on adjacent topics as well - it’ll be a production ready list of TODOs for consideration. In a part two I’ll step through configuring an example application.

item.title: Cross-Namespace Storage Data Sources In Kubernetes
item.description: An interesting new feature - currently just in alpha, which may be of interest for some use cases. Read about it here.

item.title: Clearing the CNCF CKA exam
item.description: I recently cleared the CKA. This is a 100% hands-on exam I recommend anyone working with kubernetes professionally consider studying for. Read the blog here for some preparation tips.

item.title: Vpc Endpoints and Tight Nacls
item.description: This was my first SO question. I was not disappointed by the thoughtful responses I receieved. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/69231157/ec2-instance-cant-access-amazon-linux-repos-eg-amazon-linux-extras-install-doc/69248286#69248286
